TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
I think that's an RPM camera on the Tantares probe RCS arm (or whatever it's called).

Cool, thanks.

Yup, Reddragon has it.

The station is my Tantares/NearFuture/StockalikeStationParts ISS! Album here.
Buran visits MIR

I've considered making it Hybrid-throttleable, as SRBs don't work great for Orbital insertion in KSP, IMO. Thoughts?

I do not like this idea. Love Taurus II so far though!
Moar shameless self promotion...

I do not like this idea. Love Taurus II so far though!

I'd say have two configs, one hybrid throttleable, the other a pure solid. In my mind, having a SRB second stage is a pain in the ass (I've tried), but for those purists out there, they might enjoy the challenge.

So I'd say if you could, do 2 configs.
Good news Beale! CKAN is now showing the latest versions of Tantares! Turns out that there was a problem with their indexing bot, which is now fixed.

..//...

I've considered making it Hybrid-throttleable, as SRBs don't work great for Orbital insertion in KSP, IMO. Thoughts?

..//..

I think it should stay as a regular SRB(M) as the IRL PLV has a third stage? the BTS? which could be used for orbital insertion...

I think it should stay as a regular SRB(M) as the IRL PLV has a third stage? the BTS? which could be used for orbital insertion...

Well, Cygnus was launched by Antares, which solely had a liquid first stage, and a solid second stage. The solid is used IRL for orbital insertion.

Is it possible to get the APAS in 0.625? I'm kinda going off the idea that if a CBM is most comparable to a 1.25m port (especially if you look in FusTek's direction), and the APAS is smaller than it, surely it should be 0.625? Additionally if you look at the PMAs on the ISS, that serve as adapters between CBMs and APASs, the APAS is smaller than the CBM there too. The model looks great and I'd be happy to have it, I'm just giving my 2 cents, as the saying goes

Buran visits MIR

http://i.imgur.com/9NvnP7l.png

I love it ! Only one thing to point out, you forgot a soyuz . Love the details too, kvant 2 and krystall are my favourites.
What is the difference between tantares and tantares LV

What is the difference between tantares and tantares LV

Tantares has spaceships, TantaresLV has rockets to launch them.

Beale, you're gonna need to say this on the front page or people will keep asking.

What is the difference between tantares and tantares LV

Tantares is things that travel in space like a soyuz, or a progress or a Vostock

Tantares LV is launch vehicles - specifically a 1.25m R-7/Soyuz rocket (depending on what you want to call it) a 2.5 M U500/Proton rocket (depending on what you want to call it) and a kinda huge N-1 rocket (Only one name because it didn't get a chance to get another)

Moar shameless self promotion...

That's pretty cool! Have you considered including the .CRAFT file for that? I could always use a mostly stock (From the looks of it) Buran!
Also, maybe you should make the Castor 30 like the ones from the Explorer 1 in the FASA pack. Make them a solid rocket motor, unable to be throttled, but able to be shut down.

2. How would you feel about modelling a surface-attached Soyuz periscope, with an integrated decoupler? The periscope you see above decouples (thanks, offset feature!), but I have no doubt you could make a cooler-looking one, that I could safely stick right on top of the reentry capsule hatch.

That would also have the benefit of blocking the hatch, forcing you to Eva to/from the OM.

That's pretty cool! Have you considered including the .CRAFT file for that? I could always use a mostly stock (From the looks of it) Buran!

Oh and, http://kerbalx.com/TG626/BURAN

Also, Beale, some questions!

1. Do you have a donation link for your work?

2. How would you feel about modelling a surface-attached Soyuz periscope, with an integrated decoupler? The periscope you see above decouples (thanks, offset feature!), but I have no doubt you could make a cooler-looking one, that I could safely stick right on top of the reentry capsule hatch.

That's a nice approximation!

Questions:

1. I used to, but to be honest, I decided I'm not so comfortable receiving donations.

2. That's actually a really nice idea. Also tg626 has hit the nail on the head with the "forcing to use OM" bit. I like this.

Moar shameless self promotion...

If that's self-promotion, keep it coming.

I can't wait for 1.0 to be out so I can get back into the game and start building again. I just can't justify setting up a new stable game with all the changes coming in 1.0, and with my IRL life.

I have some ideas on the next revision of .craft files.

1. Should it be hosted on KerbalX? Does it support craft packages?

2. How many different packages should there be? I'm thinking: Super-detailed, framerate murdering, CPU melting .crafts courtesy of spacecookie, simpler, basic .crafts by me, and Buran courtesy of you, since I suck at shuttles and spaceplanes.

So, basically waiting for PPTS, APAS, Pol launcher, and Angara apparently? And 1.0

If that's self-promotion, keep it coming.

I can't wait for 1.0 to be out so I can get back into the game and start building again. I just can't justify setting up a new stable game with all the changes coming in 1.0, and with my IRL life.

2. I like the idea of tiered detail selections

Whatever you wish to do, I'm happy with it and I enjoy the work.
